text: Anyone have ideas for preventing deals that don't meet certain criteria from being advanced to a different deal stage? (E.g. deal won requires a deal amount)
you can catch that before by making that field required
in the settings you can  add / remove fields that are in the Off-Canvas Card when you create a new deal, you can also make fields required there
hm, would that work if the deal itself won't start with a value but will get one shortly after being created?
I've set a discount audit workflow that will flag a deal with an improper discount value and remove the value
but they must create the value after the deal is made as it's generated by a playbook
can you make that requirement check a workflow step?
(we do weekly plans, which isn't supported by standard line items)
after created
the discount audit is a workflow step, not 100% sure how I'd set it to prevent advancement if after creating it it is then flagged and the value is removed
unless you mean a workflow that detects that it's changed deal stage and checks then?
i thought about just having a workflow that only checks if the value is zero
cause that would prevent it moving further, right?
as in if deal exists and value is 0?
what would be the effect of the workflow that would prevent it moving stage?
something like that.. hmm, well the first effect would that it would not move forward like now
then you need to decide the next step
yes, that makes sense, just thinking of _how_ it would stop it from moving forward
like, what would be the action from the workflow
enrolment trigger is deal exists, value is 0
wait until date, value is no longer 0
but missing how it would prevent the move
well, if you have users who manually drag it into the next stage, that is probably not preventable
aargh, that's how I thought - thank you anyways
I'm just really looking for almost a validation checkpoint
preventing moving the deal

Hello guys,
I have a question and I don’t know if I would have an answer here.
I would like to know about forumulário customization, I was already informed that it is only possible in css, but I would like to know if there is already some code made to be adapted for another customization.

Anyone know How we can put js file into root directory in theme which can be accessible like this

<https://www.website.com/myjsfile.js>

I’m confused about what you need if it’s not the baked-in functionality that HS has. If you navigate to Settings → Objects → Deals → Pipelines → Configure, there is an area that says “Update stage properties” from there you can set a list of properties that pop up when you move to stage _X_. You can make certain ones required or just suggested. Is that not what you need?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
how do we change a form’s business units after publish?
Pro tip: you can't :upside_down_face:
I don't think that's possible
